name: Plato
what_did:
Plato was a student of Socrates and wrote down many of his ideas.
He started a school called the Academy — one of the first universities.
He believed in a world of perfect 'forms' — like perfect justice or perfect beauty.
why_matters:
Plato helped preserve and grow philosophy.
He asked big questions about truth, justice, and the soul.
His writings shaped how people think for thousands of years.
fun_fact: Plato’s real name might have been Aristocles — ‘Plato’ was his nickname!
